verses.verse: Thus the Lord <S%H136><s%> Yahweh <S%H136><s%> showed <S%H7200><s%> me: <S%H3619><s%> behold, a basket of summer fruit. <S%H7019><s%>

He said, <S%H559><s%> "370, <S%H5986><s%> what do you see? <S%H7200><s%>" I said, <S%H559><s%> "A basket <S%H3619><s%> of summer fruit. <S%H7019><s%>" Then Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to me, <S%H7093><s%> "The end has come <S%H935><s%> on my people <S%H5971><s%> Israel. <S%H3478><s%> I will not again <S%H3254><s%> pass by them any more. <S%H5674><s%>

The songs <S%H7892><s%> of the temple <S%H1964><s%> will be wailings <S%H3213><s%> in that day, <S%H3117><s%>" says <S%H5002><s%> the Lord <S%H136><s%> Yahweh. <S%H3069><s%> "The dead bodies <S%H6297><s%> will be many. <S%H7227><s%> In every place <S%H4725><s%> they will throw them out <S%H7993><s%> with silence. <S%H2013><s%>
Hear <S%H8085><s%> this, <S%H7602><s%> you who desire to swallow up the needy, <S%H34><s%> and cause <S%H7673><s%> the poor <S%H6041><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%> to fail, <S%H7673><s%>

Saying, <S%H559><s%> <S%H2320><s%> 'When will the new moon be gone, <S%H5674><s%> that we may sell <S%H7666><s%> grain? <S%H7668><s%> And the Sabbath, <S%H7676><s%> that we may market <S%H6605><s%> wheat, <S%H1250><s%> making the ephah <S%H374><s%> small, <S%H6994><s%> and the shekel <S%H8255><s%> large, <S%H1431><s%> and dealing falsely <S%H5791><s%> with balances <S%H3976><s%> of deceit; <S%H4820><s%>

that we may buy <S%H7069><s%> the poor <S%H1800><s%> for silver, <S%H3701><s%> and the needy <S%H34><s%> for a pair of shoes, <S%H5275><s%> and sell <S%H7666><s%> the sweepings <S%H4651><s%> with the wheat? <S%H1250><s%>'"
Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> has sworn <S%H7650><s%> by the pride <S%H1347><s%> of Jacob, <S%H3290><s%> "Surely I will never <S%H5331><s%> forget <S%H7911><s%> any of their works. <S%H4639><s%>

Won't <S%H776><s%> the land tremble <S%H7264><s%> for this, <S%H56><s%> and everyone mourn who dwells <S%H3427><s%> in it? <S%H5927><s%> Yes, it will rise up wholly like the River; <S%H2975><s%> and it will be stirred <S%H1644><s%> up and sink <S%H8257><s%> again, <S%H216><s%> like the River of Egypt. <S%H4714><s%>

It will happen in that day, <S%H3117><s%>" says <S%H5002><s%> the Lord <S%H136><s%> Yahweh, <S%H3069><s%> "that I will cause the sun <S%H8121><s%> to go down <S%H935><s%> at noon, <S%H6672><s%> and I will darken <S%H2821><s%> the earth <S%H776><s%> in the clear <S%H216><s%> day. <S%H3117><s%>

I will turn <S%H2015><s%> your feasts <S%H2282><s%> into mourning, <S%H60><s%> and all your songs <S%H7892><s%> into lamentation; <S%H7015><s%> and I will make <S%H5927><s%> you wear sackcloth <S%H8242><s%> on all your bodies, <S%H4975><s%> and baldness <S%H7144><s%> on every head. <S%H7218><s%> I will make <S%H7760><s%> it like the mourning <S%H60><s%> for an only <S%H3173><s%> son, <S%H319><s%> and its end like a bitter <S%H4751><s%> day. <S%H3117><s%>

Behold, <S%H3117><s%> the days come, <S%H935><s%>" says <S%H5002><s%> the Lord <S%H136><s%> Yahweh, <S%H136><s%> "that I will send <S%H7971><s%> a famine <S%H7458><s%> in the land, <S%H776><s%> not a famine <S%H7458><s%> of bread, <S%H3899><s%> nor a thirst <S%H6772><s%> for water, <S%H4325><s%> but of hearing <S%H8085><s%> the words <S%H1697><s%> of Yahweh. <S%H3068><s%>

They will wander <S%H5128><s%> from sea <S%H3220><s%> to sea, <S%H3220><s%> and from the north <S%H6828><s%> even to the east; <S%H4217><s%> they will run back and forth <S%H7751><s%> to seek <S%H1245><s%> the word <S%H1697><s%> of Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> and will not find it. <S%H4672><s%>
In that day <S%H3117><s%> the beautiful <S%H3303><s%> virgins <S%H1330><s%> and the young men <S%H970><s%> will faint <S%H5968><s%> for thirst. <S%H6772><s%>

Those who swear <S%H7650><s%> by the sin <S%H819><s%> of Samaria, <S%H8111><s%> and say, <S%H559><s%> <S%H430><s%> 'As your god, Dan, <S%H1835><s%> lives; <S%H2416><s%>' and, <S%H1870><s%> 'As the way of Beersheba <S%H884><s%> lives; <S%H2416><s%>' they will fall, <S%H5307><s%> and never rise up again. <S%H6965><s%>"
